Welcome to picbot’s documentation!¶

Contents:

PictBot¶

Sample Slack ping bot using asyncio and websockets.

class picbot.bot.PictBot(token='xoxb-38195556468-JZDGaQf9unyPrnc90enGq9jd')[source]¶

Bases: object

This object is able to connect to Slack and to send jokes and random images from XKCD.

PictBot.connect()[source]¶

Connects the bot to Slack

PictBot.error()[source]¶

displays the error message to the channel, in case of bad input.

Retourne:error text.
PictBot.help()[source]¶

Displays the help message to the channel

Retourne:help text.
PictBot.joke()[source]¶

Select randomly a joke from the list.

Retourne:text chosen by the method.
PictBot.picture()[source]¶

Sends a picture to the channel

Retourne:URL of the image chosen by the method.
PictBot.process(message)[source]¶

Processes input messages.

Paramètres:message – brute message coming from Slack, waiting to be processed.
PictBot.sendText(message, channel_id, user_name, team_id)[source]¶

Sends a text message to the channel.

Paramètres:
  • message – the text message to sens to the channel.
  • channel_id – id of the channel to send the message to.
  • user_name – name of the user you would like to adress.
  • team_id – id of the team your bot is in.
Retourne:

answer from the api_call.

API¶

Testing the authentication on Slack API.

picbot.api.api_call(method, data=None, token='xoxb-38195556468-JZDGaQf9unyPrnc90enGq9jd')[source]¶

Slack API call.
